abstract: As the price war with Intel continued to take its toll, shares of Advanced Micro Devices fell 23 cents, or 1.6 percent.
snippet: As the price war with Intel continued to take its toll, shares of Advanced Micro Devices fell 23 cents, or 1.6 percent.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, March 5  Advanced Micro Devices said Monday that it was unlikely the company would meet its target of $1.6 billion to $1.7 billion in revenue for the first quarter, providing evidence that the price war with Intel was continuing to take its toll.

headline.main: A.M.D. Says Pricing Battle May Affect Its Revenue Goal
headline.print_headline: A.M.D. Says Pricing Battle May Affect Its Revenue Goal
